paper_title.ja: 情報処理流体力学(DFD)による雑音を含む非圧縮性速度場補正法
paper_title.en: Velocity Correction Technique for Incompressible Velocity with Noises Using Data-processing Fluid Dynamics (DFD)

description.ja: The velocity correction technique for incompressible velocity with noises is proposed by using the data-processing fluid dynamics (DFD). Two assumptions, that is, 1) the velocity field constructed by noises has the small structures, and 2) the velocity field satisfies the continuity equation for incompressible flow, are adopted. In assumption 1), the spatial filter is applied to remove the small structures. Also, Helmholtz's decomposition technique is applied to obtain the incompressible velocity, i.e., divergence free velocity. In order to validate the present approaches, Taylor-Green vortex flow and the square driven cavity flow are considered. The results show that the present techniques have the good velocity correction properties.
description.en: The velocity correction technique for incompressible velocity with noises is proposed by using the data-processing fluid dynamics (DFD). Two assumptions, that is, 1) the velocity field constructed by noises has the small structures, and 2) the velocity field satisfies the continuity equation for incompressible flow, are adopted. In assumption 1), the spatial filter is applied to remove the small structures. Also, Helmholtz's decomposition technique is applied to obtain the incompressible velocity, i.e., divergence free velocity. In order to validate the present approaches, Taylor-Green vortex flow and the square driven cavity flow are considered. The results show that the present techniques have the good velocity correction properties.

publication_name.en: Transactions of the Japan Society of Mechanical Engineers B

paper_title.en: Parallel property of pressure equation solver with variable order multigrid method for incompressible turbulent flow simulations

description.en: Tile incompressible flow simulations are usually based on the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations. Tile, elliptic partial differential equation (PDE) solvers consume the large part of total computational time. In parallel computations, tile parallel performance of elliptic PDE solver is not usually high in comparison to the momentum equation solver. The solution procedure of the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations is based on the fractional-step approach on the collocated grid system. In the spatial discretization, the convective terms are approximated by the variable-order proper convective scheme because of the consistency of the discrete continuity equation, the conservation property, and the variable order of spatial accuracy. The computation is executed with the second order of spatial accuracy. In these relaxation schemes, the RRK scheme gives good multigrid property with respect to the work unit and computational time. In both relaxation schemes, the multigrid convergence can be obtained and the RRK scheme has the independent property of spatial accuracy. The DNS of 3D turbulent channel flows is performed by the variable-order method of lines. © 2007 Copyright © 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved..

paper_title.en: Parallel property of pressure equation solver with variable order multigrid method for incompressible turbulent flow simulations

description.en: Tile incompressible flow simulations are usually based on the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations. Tile, elliptic partial differential equation (PDE) solvers consume the large part of total computational time. In parallel computations, tile parallel performance of elliptic PDE solver is not usually high in comparison to the momentum equation solver. The solution procedure of the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations is based on the fractional-step approach on the collocated grid system. In the spatial discretization, the convective terms are approximated by the variable-order proper convective scheme because of the consistency of the discrete continuity equation, the conservation property, and the variable order of spatial accuracy. The computation is executed with the second order of spatial accuracy. In these relaxation schemes, the RRK scheme gives good multigrid property with respect to the work unit and computational time. In both relaxation schemes, the multigrid convergence can be obtained and the RRK scheme has the independent property of spatial accuracy. The DNS of 3D turbulent channel flows is performed by the variable-order method of lines. © 2007 Copyright © 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved..

paper_title.ja: Development of Compressible Navier-Stokes Equations into Higher Order DNS of Incompressible Turbulence

paper_title.en: Development of Compressible Navier-Stokes Equations into Higher Order DNS of Incompressible Turbulence
Higher Order LES Solutions of Incompressible Turbulence Using Compressible Navier-Stokes Equations
Higher order parallel DNS of incompressible turbulence using compressible Navier-Stokes equations

description.en: The higher order parallel direct numerical simulation (DNS) of incompressible turbulence based on the compressible Navier-Stokes equations is carried out. The governing equations are solved by the higher order method of lines with shifted flux technique. The present higher order solutions are compared with the higher order incompressible ones obtained by the variable order method of lines. In the range of Ma=0.01, both higher order solutions are in excellent agreement with each other. In the parallel computation, the present approach shows the almost theoretical speedup.

publication_name.en: Parallel Computational Fluid Dynamics: Multidisciplinary Applications

paper_title.en: Parallel efficiency of a variable order method of lines

description.en: The parallel efficiency of a variable order method of lines on parallel platforms is investigated. The variable order method of lines shows the 91% parallel efficiency on Pilot-3 system and gives 46.3 times speed up on SSCMPP system. DNS of 3-D homogeneous isotropic turbulence is carried out. The parallel DNSs at 256 grid resolution are carried out successfully on the parallel platform with 256 PEs. In comparison with the spectral solutions, the present higher order method is as accurate as the spectral method at comparable resolution.

publication_name.en: PARALLEL COMPUTATIONAL FLUID DYNAMICS: NEW FRONTIERS AND MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPLICATIONS, PROCEEDINGS

paper_title.en: Parallel DNS of homogeneous isotropic turbulence using variable order method of lines

description.en: The DNSs of 3-D homogeneous isotropic turbulence are carried out oil parallel platforms by using a variable order method of lines,. The variable order method of lines shows the 91% parallel efficiency oil Pilot-3 system and gives 46.3 times speed up on SSCMPP system. In comparison with the spectral solutions, the present higher order method is as accurate, as the spectral method at comparable resolution. The large-scale DNSs tip to 1024(3) grid resolution are carried out, successfully oil the parallel platform with 256 PEs.

paper_title.en: Parallel efficiency of a variable order method of lines

description.en: The parallel efficiency of a variable order method of lines on parallel platforms is investigated. The variable order method of lines shows the 91% parallel efficiency on Pilot-3 system and gives 46.3 times speed up on SSCMPP system. DNS of 3-D homogeneous isotropic turbulence is carried out. The parallel DNSs at 256 grid resolution are carried out successfully on the parallel platform with 256 PEs. In comparison with the spectral solutions, the present higher order method is as accurate as the spectral method at comparable resolution.

publication_name.en: PARALLEL COMPUTATIONAL FLUID DYNAMICS: NEW FRONTIERS AND MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPLICATIONS, PROCEEDINGS

paper_title.en: A variable order method of lines: Accuracy, conservation and applications

description.en: The variable order method of lines is presented for the DNS of incompressible flows. The present method is constructed by the spatial discretization, i.e., the variable order proper convective scheme and modified differential quadrature method, and time integration. The accuracy and conservation property are validated in the 2D Taylor-Green solutions and 3D homogeneous isotropic turbulence. As applications, the flows around a circular cylinder and a sphere are simulated by using Cartesian grid approach with virtual boundary method. Consequently, the present method is very promising for the DNS of the incompressible flows.

publication_name.en: HIGH PERFORMANCE SCIENTIFIC AND ENGINEERING COMPUTING

paper_title.ja: Higher Order Direct Numerical Simulations of the Incompressible Navier-Stokes Equations Using a Variable Order Method of Lines

paper_title.en: Higher Order Direct Numerical Simulations of the Incompressible Navier-Stokes Equations Using a Variable Order Method of Lines
DNS of the incompressible flows around a sphere using Cartesian grid approach with virtual boundary method

description.en: The DNSs of the incompressible flows around a sphere are performed by using the Cartesian grid approach with virtual boundary method. In the virtual boundary method, the body surface is expressed by a set of plural points, and the velocity components on virtual boundary are feedbacked to the momentum equations as the additional forcing terms. The DNSs are carried out in the range from Re = 10 to Re = 1000. In the steady flows up to Re = 240 in order to validate the present method, the flow characteristics are in good agreement with the other results. In the unsteady flows, it is clearly observed that the hairpin vortex ring is released and the flow transits from laminar to turbulence. Consequently, the present method is very promising for the DNSs of the incompressible complicated flow.

paper_title.en: Direct Numerical Simulations of Compressible Turbulence Using Higher Order Method of Lines
Numerical solution of unsteady incompressible Navier-Stokes equations using high-order method of lines

description.en: A high-order method of lines is devised for solving the unsteady incompressible Navier-Stokes equations in the vorticity-stream function formulation. The vorticity transport equation is solved by the eight- or tenth-order method of lines and the Poisson equation for the stream function is solved by a high-order multigrid method. The numerical results of the two-dimensional (2D) homogeneous isotropic turbulence and the turbulent mixing layer are presented. In the homogeneous isotropic turbulence with tenth order of spatial accuracy, the power law of the inertial energy spectrum at the climax stage coincides with the predictions by Batchelor, Leith and Kraichnan. In the turbulent mixing layer with eight order of spatial accuracy, the vortex pairing are reproduced and the coherent structure of the Reynolds stress at the pairing is noticed. © 1994.
